title: Drawing, Doric Greek Temples of Athena (formerly Ceres), Hera II (formerly Neptune), and Hera I (formerly Basilica), Paestum, Salerno, Italy, April 1869
title_raw: Doric Greek Temples of Athena (formerly Ceres), Hera II (formerly Neptune), and Hera I (formerly Basilica), Paestum, Salerno, Italy
medium: Graphite on light brown wove paper
markings: Verso:  Stamped in ink, at lower left:  Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with color notations: at upper left, on columns:  grey / black / orange brown / orange; again, at center left over Temple of Athena: grey; again, at center over Temple of Hera II: orange yellow / grey; again, at center right over Tmepl of Hera I: 2 / upper part grey / grey temple; again, at upper left: Temple to right; again, a lower left:  distant temple decided grey / Middle temple - warm orange brown - / columns facing west <-----<< [arrow] are grey towards the bases / Rich green on slope of pediment - / Near Temple beautiful grey - But the neck of / columns under Capitals are of delicate warm orange brown; again, at lower center: briers / Hewnstones; again, at bottom center:  2 - pale lilac flowers / ground broken - gully in foreground with a few loose stones - earth blackish brown - many weeds - bushes & bricks - white open; again, at lower right:  Paestum April 69
description: Horizontal panoramic view of the three Doric Greek temples as follows: three details of columns from the Temple of Hera I [Basiclia] at the upper left; the Temple of Athena [Cere] in the distance at center left; Temple of Hera II [Neptune] at the center; Temple of Hera I at center right; with small details of grazing donkeys, flowers and a standing woman at lower center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Doric Greek Temples of Athena (formerly Ceres), Hera II (formerly Neptune), and Hera I (formerly Basilica), Paestum, Salerno, Italy, April 1869. Graphite on light brown wove paper. 
Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-592
